meta.title: Tutorial
meta.description: Build your first nutin app : a To-Do list.

title: Tutorial
presentation:
This is the very first app I built to familiarize myself with my own tool, since `construction is a very different process from use` (hi, uncle Bob). Needless to say, this first project had to be something special, rememberable, something that I've never done before.
It ended up being a To-Do list. So much for originality, but it allows for another lame nutin-related pun, so that's a fair tradeoff.
We'll use default settings, cover components, views and services, children components, and dynamic routing. We'll also use pipes and the built-in libraries snackbar and popover.
live-link: Browse a live version of the app.
important: Imports must use relative paths with the ".js" extension : import { MyClass } from './path/to/file.js';
conclusion: Thank you for following this tutorial and trying out nutin ! You should now have enough resources to build simple apps. Thanks again, and happy coding ðŸš€ !
